items.title: Clinics in New York City Schools
items.abstract: The Children’s Aid Society responds to a proposal by Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker.

items.title: Officials in Azerbaijan Claim to Restore Order to Rioting City
items.abstract: Despite the claim, residents of the city of Ismayilli said it remained on the brink of martial law after two days of protests, a rare explosion of uncontrolled frustration in the country.

items.title: Is School Designed More for Girls Than Boys?
items.abstract: Have you noticed boys who are struggling in school because of poor behavior? Do you see boys who are “smart,” yet unengaged by school? More so than girls?

items.title: 3 City Leaders Squabble Over Fines for Businesses
items.abstract: A barbed back-and-forth involving three of the city’s most powerful elected officials hinted at the emerging fault lines of the 2013 race for mayor.

items.title: Better Charter Schools in New York City
items.abstract: A new study shows how New York can build on its stronger-than-average record.

items.title: N.Y.C.F.C.’s Patrick Vieira Acknowledges ‘Long Learning Process’
items.abstract: Introduced on Wednesday as New York City F.C.’s second head coach, Vieira, 39, was confident he would overcome his lack of coaching experience and unfamiliarity with M.L.S.
keywords: New York City Football Club (Soccer Team)

items.title: How Cynthia Rowley, Fashion Designer, Spends Her Sundays
items.abstract: Ms. Rowley unwinds by doing “extreme activities” — working out, go-kart racing, sledding — with her husband and their two daughters.

items.title: How to Build Affordable Housing in New York City
items.abstract: Recent projects in which public housing was renovated by private developers could show a path forward.

items.title: Homeless Young People of New York, Overlooked and Underserved
items.abstract: As the city prepares for an annual census of the homeless population, some groups are trying to make sure people in their late teens or early 20s are not missed.

items.title: Sugarplum Fairies and Cavaliers Move Ahead at City Ballet
items.abstract: A number of dancers with roles in the latest George Balanchine’s “The Nutcracker” are making their debuts in new roles at City Ballet.

items.title: Bright Spot for N.Y.’s Struggling Schools: Pre-K
items.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s broader plan for public schools has been disappointing, but his universal pre-K initiative shows steady improvement.

items.title: N.Y. Today: The Mayor’s Vision for the City
items.abstract: Mayor de Blasio has already announced major policies, so what’s the teleprompter for? Also, “Brooklyn Nine-Nine” returns.

items.title: Learning With: ‘Students in Rural America Ask, “What Is a University Without a History Major?”’
items.abstract: What obstacles do some public universities in rural areas face?

items.title: Review: At City Ballet, Taylor Stanley Is a God for Our Time
items.abstract: Mr. Stanley’s thrillingly authoritative debut opened the winter season — and a triple bill of Balanchine-Stravinsky ballets — on a high note.

items.title: Film Club: ‘A Moment in Mexico: Ruptured City’
items.abstract: Aerial footage captures the resilience and humanity of Mexico City’s response to the 2017 earthquake.

items.title: Eric Adams Takes Office as New York City’s 110th Mayor at a Perilous Moment
items.abstract: Eric Adams, the city’s second Black mayor, faces difficult decisions over how to lead New York City through the next wave of the pandemic.

items.title: City Schools Are ‘Staying Open,’ Mayor Eric Adams Says
items.abstract: But the spike in Omicron cases has created trepidation for many parents.

items.title: Adrienne Adams Makes History as First Black N.Y.C. Council Speaker
items.abstract: Ms. Adams, who became speaker on Wednesday, will lead the most diverse City Council ever as New York tries to recover from the pandemic. She already faces battles with the mayor.

items.title: ‘Attempted Security Threat’ Disables Software at Some New York Schools
items.abstract: The outage in a platform used by teachers and students has caused another disruption for a system that has had its share amid the pandemic.
keywords: Goldstein, Leon M, High School for the Sciences (Brooklyn, NY)

items.title: How a Boy in Rural Iceland Became a Tool for Global Fascism
items.abstract: “Red Milk,” a novel by Sjón, examines a young man’s path to neo-Nazism.
